answers.a: That measures hardness and Young’s modulus during indentation of material
answers.b: That provides only hardness of material during indentation of material
answers.c: That provides only elastic modulus during indentation of material
answers.d: That records instantaneous load vs displacement during indentation of material

explanations.a: Measurement is eventual, but the recording of instantaneous displacement at applied load makes it ‘instrumented’ indentation.

answers.a: Hardness is defined as resistance of material against wear and erosion
answers.b: Hardness is defined as resistance of material against indentation, scratch and plastic deformation
answers.c: Hardness is defined as resistance of material against corrosion
answers.d: Hardness is defined as resistance of material against passage of electrical current

explanations.a: Hardness is defined as resistance of material against indentation, scratch and plastic deformation. The ability of material to resist from imparting any impression of indent or change of shape or any damage is called as hardness.
explanations.b: Hardness is defined as resistance of material against indentation, scratch and plastic deformation. The ability of material to resist from imparting any impression of indent or change of shape or any damage is called as hardness.
explanations.c: Hardness is defined as resistance of material against indentation, scratch and plastic deformation. The ability of material to resist from imparting any impression of indent or change of shape or any damage is called as hardness.
explanations.d: Hardness is defined as resistance of material against indentation, scratch and plastic deformation. The ability of material to resist from imparting any impression of indent or change of shape or any damage is called as hardness.

explanations.a: Hardness is defined as the contact resistance (i.e. resistance offered by the contact area) of material against applied load during indentation.
explanations.b: Hardness is defined as the contact resistance (i.e. resistance offered by the contact area) of material against applied load during indentation.
explanations.c: Hardness is defined as the contact resistance (i.e. resistance offered by the contact area) of material against applied load during indentation.
explanations.d: Hardness is defined as the contact resistance (i.e. resistance offered by the contact area) of material against applied load during indentation.

answers.a: Young’s modulus is defined as the maximum strength of material before fracture
answers.b: Young’s modulus is defined as the strength of material at yield point
answers.c: Young’s modulus is defined as the ratio of stress to strain in the linearly elastic region of stress-strain curve
answers.d: Young’s modulus is defined as the slope of stress to that of strain in the stress-strain curve before failure

explanations.a: Young’s modulus governs stiffness of material, and is evaluated via slope (stress to strain ratio) in the elastic region of stress-strain curve (i.e. when Hooke’s law is valid)
explanations.b: Young’s modulus governs stiffness of material, and is evaluated via slope (stress to strain ratio) in the elastic region of stress-strain curve (i.e. when Hooke’s law is valid)
explanations.c: Young’s modulus governs stiffness of material, and is evaluated via slope (stress to strain ratio) in the elastic region of stress-strain curve (i.e. when Hooke’s law is valid)
explanations.d: Young’s modulus governs stiffness of material, and is evaluated via slope (stress to strain ratio) in the elastic region of stress-strain curve (i.e. when Hooke’s law is valid)

answers.a: Nanoindentation is the indentation when load is in the order of ~100s nN (nano-Newtons)
answers.b: Nanoindentation is the indentation when displacement depth load is in the order of ~100s nm (nano-meters)
answers.c: Nanoindentation is the indentation when duration of dwell time of the indenter at maximum load is in the order of ~100s ns (nano-seconds)
answers.d: Nanoindentation is the indentation when the measurement time is in the order of ~100s ns (nano-seconds)

explanations.a: Nanoindentation technique utilized indentation depth regime in the range of ~100s of nm.
explanations.b: Nanoindentation technique utilized indentation depth regime in the range of ~100s of nm.
explanations.c: Nanoindentation technique utilized indentation depth regime in the range of ~100s of nm.
explanations.d: Nanoindentation technique utilized indentation depth regime in the range of ~100s of nm.
